alert.note: Alert for Logan; Scott (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 02 at 5:43PM CDT until May 02 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Logan County in western Arkansas... Northern Scott County in western Arkansas... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 543 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hartford, or 15 miles east of Poteau, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Booneville... Mansfield... Magazine... Echo... Barber... Lucas... Chismville... Liberty... Sugar Grove... Carolan... Grayson... Glendale in Logan County... Ione... Elm Park... Hon... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for western Arkansas. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for western Arkansas.
